programme.title: Zieja
Zieja
programme.desc:
Zieja: Directed by Robert Glinski. With Andrzej Seweryn, Mateusz Wieclawek, Zbigniew Zamachowski, Slawomir Orzechowski. The 70s. A Security Service Major wishes to "buy" gullible priest Zieja and turn him into an agent who will discredit the opposition. The priest's interrogations become a natural pretext for a journey through the history of Poland in the twentieth century: from the Bolshevik war of 1920, through World War II, up to modern times. It turns out that the seemingly naive Father Zieja is actually a clever rebel. The world he lived in was unacceptable to him. He was ahead of his time. A lonely journey without a passport to Rome in the 1930s turned into thoughts of a European Union. Performing the Catholic funeral rites of a woman who committed suicide (during the 20s of the past century) was an protest against the church's rules. Proclaiming the slogan "never kill anyone, not even your enemies" during the Second World War, was against patriotic mythologies and foretold future pacifist attitudes. Zieja puts his life and freedom on the line in the name of moral, ethical and religious values in which he believed. The film "Zieja" is rooted in the movement of Polish Catholicism, which is based on high ethical standards, poverty and tolerance, as well as respect and love for other human beings." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10136434/","name":"Zieja","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzcyMDNiZDctYjg3OS00OTU2LWE2ZGMtZThjZmM0YmI3NjQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEwMTY3NDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The 70s. A Security Service Major wishes to "buy" gullible priest Zieja and turn him into an agent who will discredit the opposition. The priest's interrogations become a natural pretext for a journey through the history of Poland in","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10136434/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"morrison-dylan-fan"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"The passage of Jan Zieja.","reviewBody":"After having gone to see Tenet (2020) the day before I spoke to a friend on the phone about what other films were coming out. Getting told that the local Odeon were doing a one-off screening of a interesting-sounding Polish Drama later that day,I got set to meet Zieja.

Note:Some spoilers in review.

View on the film:

On opposing sides not only round the table, but also morally, Andrzej Seweryn and Zbigniew Zamachowski set the screen ablaze in Zieja and Grosicki's interrogation sequences, thanks to the stamping of feet frustration Zamachowski gives Grosicki being counted in this psychological duel with a upright, quiet confidence Seweryn has beaming from every word of Zieja.

A important figure sadly not that well known outside of Poland, the screenplay by Wojciech Lepianka spans a impressively compact bio-pic on Jan Zieja, going right back in flashbacks to Zieja's involvement in the Warsaw Uprising,to the 70's,where Zieja's liberal liturgical catches the attention of the Communists secret services.

Based around the interrogation with Zieja and Grosicki, Lepianka's consistent move to flashbacks gives what should be the centrepiece of the title a stop-start atmosphere, where just as tensions are starting to build, Lepianka steps back and enters a flashback.

Rolling up the opening sequence to Grosicki being a slob in bed, director Robert Glinski & cinematographer Witold Plociennik firmly place Zieja on the other side with graceful close-ups and splintered shadows casting a spiritual aura on Zieja.

Closely working with editor Ewa Smal, Glinski stylishly links Zieja's experience at the interrogation table with the horrors he's faced in life,via pristine match-cuts linking the flashbacks and the present into each other,along with eye-catch screen-wipes performed by Zieja walking across the screen to deliver a sermon.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":93,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-08-28","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0786614/","name":"Andrzej Seweryn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5851110/","name":"Mateusz Wieclawek"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0952498/","name":"Zbigniew Zamachowski"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322894/","name":"Robert Glinski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0087308/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0185099/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0503287/","name":"Wojciech Lepianka"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Charlie Chaplin kontra FBI
programme.desc: Edgar Hoover to dyrektor FBI, który przez wiele lat prowadził obsesyjne dochodzenie w sprawie Charliego Chaplina. Mężczyzna szukał dowodów na to, że komik jest komunistycznym szpiegiem. W wielu filmach Chaplin wyśmiewał kapitalizm i konsumpcyjny styl życia Amerykanów, mówił też o bezsensie prowadzenia wojen, których celem jest wyłącznie nabijanie kieszeni rządzącym. Twórcy filmu przyglądają się tej sprawie.

programme.title: Aktualności filmowe+
programme.desc: W cotygodniowym programie zostają przedstawione najbardziej interesujące wydarzenia ze świata kina. Pojawiają się wywiady z osobami związanymi z branżą filmową, prowadzone są rozmowy na temat premier, nowości muzycznych i teatralnych.

programme.title: Ordinary Love
Zwyczajna miłość
Ordinary Love
programme.desc:
Ordinary Love: Directed by Lisa Barros D'Sa, Glenn Leyburn. With Lesley Manville, Liam Neeson, Esh Alladi, Melanie Clark Pullen. An extraordinary look at the lives of a middle-aged couple in the midst of the wife's breast cancer diagnosis." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6012380/","name":"Ordinary Love","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODIwNDVlODEtMGIxNC00OGQ4LTgzMmUtNmI4MjJhYjU3MDJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDY2MjcyOTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"An extraordinary look at the lives of a middle-aged couple in the midst of the wife's breast cancer diagnosis.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6012380/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TxMike"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Realistic story about ordinary love, husband and wife in their 60s.","reviewBody":"As I watched this I found myself wondering how younger folks react to this movie. My wife and I are in a similar situation, older, retired, and long-time married. Our daily life and conversations are not that different from what is depicted here.

Lesley Manville (early 60s) is Joan and Liam Neeson (late 60s) is her husband Tom. As the movie begins they are on one of their walks, her short legs must move almost twice as fast as his. After they cross the bridge and get to a certain tree they turn around and head back. About 12 months later the movie ends the very same way.

In between Joan discovers a lump in one of her breasts and this starts a series of doctor visits, hospital visits, treatments, and making unexpected new friends. The movie examines the relationship between the long-time married couple, their devotion to each other, their working together to get past this big speed bump in life.

This is a good movie, we enjoyed it at home on DVD from our public library. Romantic attraction is usually what gets a couple together but ordinary love is what keeps them together."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3805,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2019-12-06","keywords":"cancer,middle aged couple,chemotherapy,gay couple,hospital","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1637400345","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGZlZjUzZjYtN2I3MC00MWQzLWI4Y2YtNWE1M2ZhMzk4ZGM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGZlZjUzZjYtN2I3MC00MWQzLWI4Y2YtNWE1M2ZhMzk4ZGM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Joan and Tom have been married for many years. There is an ease to their relationship which only comes from spending a lifetime together and a depth of love which expresses itself through tenderness and humor in equal part. When Joan is diagnosed with breast cancer, the course of her treatment shines a light on their relationship as they are faced with the challenges that lie ahead and the prospect of what might become of them if something were to happen to her."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0544334/","name":"Lesley Manville"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000553/","name":"Liam Neeson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4923736/","name":"Esh Alladi"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2443600/","name":"Lisa Barros D'Sa"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2441296/","name":"Glenn Leyburn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0387611/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0453620/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0121295/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1652160/","name":"Owen McCafferty"}],"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: La vérité
Prawda
La vérité
programme.desc:
La vérité: Directed by Hirokazu Koreeda. With Catherine Deneuve, Juliette Binoche, Ethan Hawke, Clémentine Grenier. A stormy reunion between scriptwriter Lumir with her famous mother and actress, Fabienne, against the backdrop of Fabienne's autobiographic book and her latest role in a Sci-Fi picture as a daughter of a mother who never grows old." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8323120/","name":"La vérité","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDJjMTVhMzMtOTQwNC00MzVkLWE3YjMtMjkwYTQ0YzEyMjBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY3Nzc0OTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A stormy reunion between scriptwriter Lumir with her famous mother and actress, Fabienne, against the backdrop of Fabienne's autobiographic book and her latest role in a Sci-Fi picture as a daughter of a mother who never grows old.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8323120/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MartinHafer"},"dateCreated":"2019-11-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Surprisingly okay....and not much more","reviewBody":"The Japanese filmmaker Hirokazu Koreeda is famous for focusing on some of the darker aspects of what it is to be Japanese. Some folks in his homeland (including some politicians) have criticized his films for exposing these problem....though many film buffs have loved these same films. It's surprising, then, when you watch "The Truth"....not just because it has an all French and American cast but because unlike his films such as "Like Father, Like Son" and "Shoplifters", he DOES pull his punches and more often than not avoids pushing boundaries! As a result, my daughter and I enjoyed the film but were also very disappointed.

The film stars Catherine Deneuve and Juliet Binoche as a self-absorbed mother and her frustrated daughter during a visit. And, amazingly, by the end of the story, nothing much happens....few sparks and the big confrontation scene you expect (because the daughter deservedly resents her mother) never really materialize and the mother somehow receives absolution though she did little to merit it....again, NOT like what you'd expect in a Hirokazu Koreeda movie.

Overall, the acting was good but the story itself a bit flat.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6162,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-10-11","keywords":"aging actress,acting,tortoise,dog,title is not in english","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1405009689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjlmODk2MjktMWNmNC00M2U1LWJkOTUtMjUwNGJiMDVhZDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjlmODk2MjktMWNmNC00M2U1LWJkOTUtMjUwNGJiMDVhZDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000366/","name":"Catherine Deneuve"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000300/","name":"Juliette Binoche"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000160/","name":"Ethan Hawke"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0466153/","name":"Hirokazu Koreeda"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0029856/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0567389/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0705123/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0466153/","name":"Hirokazu Koreeda"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7408787/","name":"Ken Liu"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 8323120, Title: La vérité, --- Description: La vérité: Directed by Hirokazu Koreeda. With Catherine Deneuve, Juliette Binoche, Ethan Hawke, Clémentine Grenier. A stormy reunion between scriptwriter Lumir with her famous mother and actress, Fabienne, against the backdrop of Fabienne's autobiographic book and her latest role in a Sci-Fi picture as a daughter of a mother who never grows old." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8323120/","name":"La vérité","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDJjMTVhMzMtOTQwNC00MzVkLWE3YjMtMjkwYTQ0YzEyMjBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY3Nzc0OTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A stormy reunion between scriptwriter Lumir with her famous mother and actress, Fabienne, against the backdrop of Fabienne's autobiographic book and her latest role in a Sci-Fi picture as a daughter of a mother who never grows old.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8323120/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"MartinHafer","dateCreated":"2019-11-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Surprisingly okay....and not much more","reviewBody":"The Japanese filmmaker Hirokazu Koreeda is famous for focusing on some of the darker aspects of what it is to be Japanese. Some folks in his homeland (including some politicians) have criticized his films for exposing these problem....though many film buffs have loved these same films. It's surprising, then, when you watch "The Truth"....not just because it has an all French and American cast but because unlike his films such as "Like Father, Like Son" and "Shoplifters", he DOES pull his punches and more often than not avoids pushing boundaries! As a result, my daughter and I enjoyed the film but were also very disappointed.

The film stars Catherine Deneuve and Juliet Binoche as a self-absorbed mother and her frustrated daughter during a visit. And, amazingly, by the end of the story, nothing much happens....few sparks and the big confrontation scene you expect (because the daughter deservedly resents her mother) never really materialize and the mother somehow receives absolution though she did little to merit it....again, NOT like what you'd expect in a Hirokazu Koreeda movie.

Overall, the acting was good but the story itself a bit flat.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6162,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-10-11","keywords":"aging actress,acting,tortoise,dog,title is not in english","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1405009689","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjlmODk2MjktMWNmNC00M2U1LWJkOTUtMjUwNGJiMDVhZDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjlmODk2MjktMWNmNC00M2U1LWJkOTUtMjUwNGJiMDVhZDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000366/","name":"Catherine Deneuve","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000300/","name":"Juliette Binoche","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000160/","name":"Ethan Hawke"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0466153/","name":"Hirokazu Koreeda"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0029856/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0567389/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0705123/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0466153/","name":"Hirokazu Koreeda","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7408787/","name":"Ken Liu"],"duration":"PT1H46M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Thin Red Line
Cienka czerwona linia
The Thin Red Line
programme.desc:
The Thin Red Line: Directed by Terrence Malick. With Kirk Acevedo, Penelope Allen, Benjamin Green, Simon Billig. Adaptation of James Jones' autobiographical 1962 novel, focusing on the conflict at Guadalcanal during the second World War." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120863/","name":"The Thin Red Line","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjEzMTM2NjAtNWFmZC00MTVlLTgyMmQtMGQyNTFjZDk5N2NmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzQ1ODk3MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Adaptation of James Jones' autobiographical 1962 novel, focusing on the conflict at Guadalcanal during the second World War.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120863/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gabbagabbahey"},"dateCreated":"2000-04-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"A diagnosis","reviewBody":"The greatest fault of The Thin Red Line was its timing - it was released at around the same time as Spielberg's Saving Private Ryan. While most people dismissed The Thin Red Line as the `other' World War II movie of 1998, it's actually a very different kind of film - the film itself is not hurt by similarity to Ryan but was hurt commercially due to the misconception. It's easy to forget that Red was nominated for seven Oscars. This is an extraordinary film that can stand well on its own next to Ryan.

Saving Private Ryan was significant in that it visually depicted war in a realistic, gritty way. The Thin Red Line's focus is more philosophical. It is about the contradiction between the beauty of nature and the destructive nature of men. The movie cuts continuously between the external struggle of American GIs fighting to take a crucial hill from Japanese occupation on Guadalcanal - and more importantly, the internal chaos of war as every man tries to come to his own terms about matters such as morals, death, God, and love.

Unlike in Saving Private Ryan, there is nothing patriotic about this movie. In fact, there probably has never been a more anti-war film. The fighting men here are disillusioned, lost, and frightened. They don't fight for their country or "democracy" - they fight because they have to. The only priorities are survival, and - for the more humane - caring for their comrades. Renowned composer Hans Zimmer - who won an Oscar nomination for his work-captures the grim mood perfectly and allows us to hear the men's thoughts.

The characters are portrayed by a strong ensemble cast. Acting is uniformly excellent, especially Nick Nolte as Colonel Tall, who is the unfeeling commander of the ground offensive on Guadalcanal. Thoroughly unlikable, he is the closest thing to a villain in the movie. After studying war for an untold number of years, Tall sees Guadalcanal as his chance to prove himself and move up in the ranks - the men are only a tool to accomplish this goal and expendable. In one crucial scene, he orders a captain (played by Elias Koteas, in another outstanding role) to lead his men to a frontal assault against a Japanese controlled hill. When the captain suggests a more logical alternative, the colonel screams: "You are not gonna take your men around in the jungle to avoid a goddamn fight!" To this, the captain replies, `I've lived with these men, sir, for two and a half years and I will not order them all to their deaths.' Later, when the hill is taken, he is dismissed of his duties as Tall sees him as a threat to the successful achievement of his goal. Certainly, not every commander must have been that coldhearted and selfish, but surely some were, though not necessarily to that extreme.

While the acting is very good, much of the cast is relatively unknown and it can initially be hard to distinguish the characters from each other as they may appear to be very similar. They are all about the same age, have dirt smeared over their faces, and wear helmets and the same military garb. Also, the stars in this movie have very small roles. George Clooney and John Travolta are credited with starring roles while really little more than extras - clearly for marketing purposes. You will not see more than two minutes of each.

One of the main themes of the movie is the contrast between nature and men's destructiveness in war. The director, Terrence Malick, hired cinematographer John Toll to capture this on camera, and towards achieving that goal they couldn't have been more successful. The almost surreal scenery is nothing short of stunning and has the same visual impact as any special effect. The beauty of nature is always present, even when it is a setting for battle of destruction, and death.

Though the battle scenes fall short of the frightening realism in Saving Private Ryan, they are heads and soldiers above every previous attempt. One truly gets the sense that war is a chaotic, often hopeless environment where it is only a matter of luck whether you survive or get killed.

 `How did we lose the good that was given us? Or let it slip away? Scatter it carelessly ... trade it for what has no worth?' The film is filled with such poetic questions as to which there are no real answers. This is definitely not a party movie. There isn't anything uplifting about it - it is downright depressing. Asides from entertainment value, however, this is a film that makes you think.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":181622,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","History","War"],"datePublished":"1999-03-10","keywords":"battle,tropical island,jungle,guadalcanal,hill","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Thin Red Line","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1266944281","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM5MjgxZjYtMDBiZC00ZDliLTg5YzUtNWY1MThkMWE3ZGY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM5MjgxZjYtMDBiZC00ZDliLTg5YzUtNWY1MThkMWE3ZGY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Criterion trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001029/","name":"Jim Caviezel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000576/","name":"Sean Penn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000560/","name":"Nick Nolte"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000517/","name":"Terrence Malick"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036867/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0029574/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0428296/","name":"James Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000517/","name":"Terrence Malick"}],"duration":"PT2H50M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0120863, Title: The Thin Red Line, --- Description: The Thin Red Line: Directed by Terrence Malick. With Kirk Acevedo, Penelope Allen, Benjamin Green, Simon Billig. Adaptation of James Jones' autobiographical 1962 novel, focusing on the conflict at Guadalcanal during the second World War." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120863/","name":"The Thin Red Line","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjEzMTM2NjAtNWFmZC00MTVlLTgyMmQtMGQyNTFjZDk5N2NmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzQ1ODk3MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Adaptation of James Jones' autobiographical 1962 novel, focusing on the conflict at Guadalcanal during the second World War.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120863/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"gabbagabbahey","dateCreated":"2000-04-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"A diagnosis","reviewBody":"The greatest fault of The Thin Red Line was its timing - it was released at around the same time as Spielberg's Saving Private Ryan. While most people dismissed The Thin Red Line as the `other' World War II movie of 1998, it's actually a very different kind of film - the film itself is not hurt by similarity to Ryan but was hurt commercially due to the misconception. It's easy to forget that Red was nominated for seven Oscars. This is an extraordinary film that can stand well on its own next to Ryan.

Saving Private Ryan was significant in that it visually depicted war in a realistic, gritty way. The Thin Red Line's focus is more philosophical. It is about the contradiction between the beauty of nature and the destructive nature of men. The movie cuts continuously between the external struggle of American GIs fighting to take a crucial hill from Japanese occupation on Guadalcanal - and more importantly, the internal chaos of war as every man tries to come to his own terms about matters such as morals, death, God, and love.

Unlike in Saving Private Ryan, there is nothing patriotic about this movie. In fact, there probably has never been a more anti-war film. The fighting men here are disillusioned, lost, and frightened. They don't fight for their country or "democracy" - they fight because they have to. The only priorities are survival, and - for the more humane - caring for their comrades. Renowned composer Hans Zimmer - who won an Oscar nomination for his work-captures the grim mood perfectly and allows us to hear the men's thoughts.

The characters are portrayed by a strong ensemble cast. Acting is uniformly excellent, especially Nick Nolte as Colonel Tall, who is the unfeeling commander of the ground offensive on Guadalcanal. Thoroughly unlikable, he is the closest thing to a villain in the movie. After studying war for an untold number of years, Tall sees Guadalcanal as his chance to prove himself and move up in the ranks - the men are only a tool to accomplish this goal and expendable. In one crucial scene, he orders a captain (played by Elias Koteas, in another outstanding role) to lead his men to a frontal assault against a Japanese controlled hill. When the captain suggests a more logical alternative, the colonel screams: "You are not gonna take your men around in the jungle to avoid a goddamn fight!" To this, the captain replies, `I've lived with these men, sir, for two and a half years and I will not order them all to their deaths.' Later, when the hill is taken, he is dismissed of his duties as Tall sees him as a threat to the successful achievement of his goal. Certainly, not every commander must have been that coldhearted and selfish, but surely some were, though not necessarily to that extreme.

While the acting is very good, much of the cast is relatively unknown and it can initially be hard to distinguish the characters from each other as they may appear to be very similar. They are all about the same age, have dirt smeared over their faces, and wear helmets and the same military garb. Also, the stars in this movie have very small roles. George Clooney and John Travolta are credited with starring roles while really little more than extras - clearly for marketing purposes. You will not see more than two minutes of each.

One of the main themes of the movie is the contrast between nature and men's destructiveness in war. The director, Terrence Malick, hired cinematographer John Toll to capture this on camera, and towards achieving that goal they couldn't have been more successful. The almost surreal scenery is nothing short of stunning and has the same visual impact as any special effect. The beauty of nature is always present, even when it is a setting for battle of destruction, and death.

Though the battle scenes fall short of the frightening realism in Saving Private Ryan, they are heads and soldiers above every previous attempt. One truly gets the sense that war is a chaotic, often hopeless environment where it is only a matter of luck whether you survive or get killed.

 `How did we lose the good that was given us? Or let it slip away? Scatter it carelessly ... trade it for what has no worth?' The film is filled with such poetic questions as to which there are no real answers. This is definitely not a party movie. There isn't anything uplifting about it - it is downright depressing. Asides from entertainment value, however, this is a film that makes you think.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":181622,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","History","War"],"datePublished":"1999-03-10","keywords":"battle,tropical island,jungle,guadalcanal,hill","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Thin Red Line","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1266944281","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM5MjgxZjYtMDBiZC00ZDliLTg5YzUtNWY1MThkMWE3ZGY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM5MjgxZjYtMDBiZC00ZDliLTg5YzUtNWY1MThkMWE3ZGY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Criterion trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001029/","name":"Jim Caviezel","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000576/","name":"Sean Penn","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000560/","name":"Nick Nolte"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000517/","name":"Terrence Malick"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036867/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0029574/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0428296/","name":"James Jones","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000517/","name":"Terrence Malick"],"duration":"PT2H50M"</script><metacontent="

Film was well done. It depicts the misunderstandings among some young polish provincial people, who have the ambitions to crop up in the new post-communist, re-capitalist society.

While the young women in the film are trying to escape the disconsolately life by either getting know established oldsters or by giving birth to numerous children, the young men decide to rob a bank. Things get wrong, one of the guys flips out and kills four people.

The film is supposed to be based on a true story which has happened for about 3-4 years in Warsaw. The screenplay makes use of many clichés, otherwise film is well done."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":144,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2005-11-11","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2027064/","name":"Robert Olech"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1644158/","name":"Piotr Glowacki"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2021835/","name":"Cezary Lukaszewicz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0941829/","name":"Leszek Wosiewicz"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0941829/","name":"Leszek Wosiewicz"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hollywood Buzz
programme.desc: W programie nowości kinowe, relacje z planów zdjęciowych oraz ciekawostki związanych z gwiazdami srebrnego ekranu. O pracy nad najnowszymi hollywoodzkimi produkcjami opowiadają ich twórcy - znani reżyserzy i aktorzy. Autorzy magazynu przedstawiają również zwiastuny filmów wchodzących na ekrany kin.

The Congress
programme.desc: The Congress: Directed by Ari Folman. With Robin Wright, Harvey Keitel, Sami Gayle, Jon Hamm. An aging, out-of-work actress accepts one last job, though the consequences of her decision affect her in ways she didn't consider." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1821641/","name":"The Congress","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE5MTUzNDk3M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTUwNTQ5MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"An aging, out-of-work actress accepts one last job, though the consequences of her decision affect her in ways she didn't consider.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1821641/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MdlndeHond"},"dateCreated":"2013-12-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Beautifully executed doom Scifi","reviewBody":"It's two movies really the first part where you feel the impending doom set upon Robin Wright as she is caught between either professionally die off soon or make a deal that takes it all. \n\nIt so vividly explores the fine line between choice and the illusion of having one. The second part has a strong resemblance to Waking Life in it's psychedelic execution more than Waltz with Bashir. Existentialism, morality, Corporatocracy and the beautiful animation make this the most marvellous yet terrifying Sci-fi I have seen in ages. Watch Harvey Keitels monologue in the first half, it is outstanding. Robin Wright is as always amazing and gets extra kudos for playing herself in an alternate universe where her career has failed. It is all together a masterpiece.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18236,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Animation","Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2013-07-03","keywords":"female protagonist,satire,dystopia,cinema,tom cruise character","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi892512537","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjk1ODkwNzMwNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU3NDAwMDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjk1ODkwNzMwNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU3NDAwMDE@._V1_.jpg","description":" \tAn aging, out-of-work actress accepts one last job, though the consequences of her decision affect her in ways she didn't consider"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000705/","name":"Robin Wright"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000172/","name":"Harvey Keitel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0358316/","name":"Jon Hamm"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0284369/","name":"Ari Folman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0232356/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052813/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0501015/","name":"Stanislaw Lem"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0284369/","name":"Ari Folman"}],"duration":"PT2H2M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial
E.T.
E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial
programme.desc: E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial: Directed by Steven Spielberg. With Dee Wallace, Henry Thomas, Peter Coyote, Robert MacNaughton. A troubled child summons the courage to help a friendly alien escape Earth and return to his home world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0083866/","name":"E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2ODFlMDAtNzdhOC00ZDYzLWE3YTMtNDU4ZGFmZmJmYTczXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A troubled child summons the courage to help a friendly alien escape Earth and return to his home world.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0083866/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Catherine_Grace_Zeh"},"dateCreated":"2005-12-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very touching movie about a special friendship for all ages that will warm your heart and make you cry","reviewBody":"E.T. THE EXTRA TERRESTRIAL, in my opinion, is a very touching movie about a special friendship for all ages that will warm your heart and make you cry. I really loved the magic that E.T. performed. If I could have, I would have helped him get to safety myself. The only problem is how I would get him to safety, since I can't drive. The score was good, the costumes were perfectly designed, everyone was cast perfectly, and the direction was flawless. In conclusion, I highly recommend this very touching movie about a special friendship for all ages to anyone who hasn't seen it. You're in for a real treat and a good time, so go to the video store, rent it or buy it, kick back with someone close to you, and watch it. THE EXTRA TERRESTRIAL, in my opinion, is a very touching movie about a special friendship for all ages that will warm your heart and make you cry. I really loved the magic that E.T. performed. If I could have, I would have helped him get to safety myself. The only problem is how I would get him to safety, since I can't drive. The score was good, the costumes were perfectly designed, everyone was cast perfectly, and the direction was flawless. In conclusion, I highly recommend this very touching movie about a special friendship for all ages to anyone who hasn't seen it. You're in for a real treat and a good time, so go to the video store, rent it or buy it, kick back with someone close to you, and watch it. programme.title: Safe Spaces
Strefa komfortu
Safe Spaces
programme.desc: Safe Spaces: Directed by Daniel Schechter. With Justin Long, Kate Berlant, Lynn Cohen, Michael Godere. An NYC professor spends a week re-connecting with his family while defending his reputation over controversial behavior at his college." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7187768/","name":"Safe Spaces","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGU4MTdkMTMtOWFjOC00YzM5LThlOTctODk5OGJjMDY3ZDZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTU5Mzk0NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"An NYC professor spends a week re-connecting with his family while defending his reputation over controversial behavior at his college.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7187768/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jmiller21"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"The power of family and the insanity of liberal universities","reviewBody":"There is a good story here. How a family pulls together during a trying time, despite their differences, conflicts and foibles to love and care for each other. There is nonsense here that I fear may be an all too real ultra sensitivity that pervades liberal campuses. While the traumatic difficulties that one may face in their youth may be regrettable, there is no way that the Jennifer Mann character will be able to function in real life if she thinks she can live in a bubble of protection from someone hurting her delicate sensitivities. In some ways this is a powerful contrasts. There is family where there is acceptable and strengthening of backbone and character by the sibling rivalries that persist. Without realizing it, perhaps this movie is a meaningful criticism of the politically correct culture that weakens our fiber and a call to family to strengthen it. Put the challenges Agatha and her story of escaping Nazi Germany, learning a new language and a new life, and facing death and the strength she showed in contrast with the "triggered" response of students seemingly can't deal with the simple realities of seeing another person feel bad to the point of threatening a professor's job. A normal human being would simply experience the class, discount the remarks that the professor made, perhaps utter a "meh" and go one with their own life. The contrast of Agatha to the youth of today is damning.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":661,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-11-15","keywords":"jew,jewish,teacher student relationship,adjunct professor,family relationships","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"After Class","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1908522777","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmVlYjA0NDEtMDAxYy00MjVjLTgzYTEtNmRlOGE0MDUwNWQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmVlYjA0NDEtMDAxYy00MjVjLTgzYTEtNmRlOGE0MDUwNWQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0519043/","name":"Justin Long"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2547958/","name":"Kate Berlant"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0169565/","name":"Lynn Cohen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1633080/","name":"Daniel Schechter"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0474730/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1633080/","name":"Daniel Schechter"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Photograph
Fotografia
The Photograph
programme.desc: The Photograph: Directed by Stella Meghie. With Issa Rae, LaKeith Stanfield, Chanté Adams, Y'lan Noel. A series of intertwining love stories set in the past and in the present." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7798646/","name":"The Photograph","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjY3OWY4NDMtNmMwYy00ODNmLTljODAtMzEyNWI5ZDc1YzU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A series of intertwining love stories set in the past and in the present.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7798646/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"SnobReviews"},"dateCreated":"2020-05-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Slow paced but beautifully shot and wonderfully acted.","reviewBody":"Fueled by the fiery chemistry between Issa Rae and Lakeith Stanfield, "The Photograph" gives viewers a love story that transcends time and is worth sticking around for. . In this romantic drama, the estranged daughter of a famous photographer falls in love with the journalist who is investigating her late mother's life. . Beautifully shot, wonderfully acted and even original at times, "The Photograph" is slow paced and won't be for everyone but the pay out is worth it. Issa Rae and Lakeith Stanfield burn up the screen with their intense performances, you'd think they were actually a couple. I thought the premise was interesting and even though "The Photograph" is not perfect, it felt good to watch a romantic drama; a genre that isn't as tackled in this day and age of film. . A series of intertwining love stories set in the past and in the present." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7798646/","name":"The Photograph","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjY3OWY4NDMtNmMwYy00ODNmLTljODAtMzEyNWI5ZDc1YzU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A series of intertwining love stories set in the past and in the present.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7798646/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"SnobReviews","dateCreated":"2020-05-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Slow paced but beautifully shot and wonderfully acted.","reviewBody":"Fueled by the fiery chemistry between Issa Rae and Lakeith Stanfield, "The Photograph" gives viewers a love story that transcends time and is worth sticking around for. . In this romantic drama, the estranged daughter of a famous photographer falls in love with the journalist who is investigating her late mother's life. . Beautifully shot, wonderfully acted and even original at times, "The Photograph" is slow paced and won't be for everyone but the pay out is worth it. Issa Rae and Lakeith Stanfield burn up the screen with their intense performances, you'd think they were actually a couple. I thought the premise was interesting and even though "The Photograph" is not perfect, it felt good to watch a romantic drama; a genre that isn't as tackled in this day and age of film. . Straceńcy
Body Brokers
programme.desc: Body Brokers: Directed by John Swab. With Suzanne Wind, Frank Grillo, Alice Englert, Samone James. Brought to Los Angeles for treatment, a recovering junkie soon learns that the rehab center is not about helping people, but a cover for a multi-billion-dollar fraud operation that enlists addicts to recruit other addicts." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9585676/","name":"Body Brokers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmYzMjQ4ZTAtMjI0OC00ZDhiLWJkMzctMDgxYTI2ZDRiYTg0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Brought to Los Angeles for treatment, a recovering junkie soon learns that the rehab center is not about helping people, but a cover for a multi-billion-dollar fraud operation that enlists addicts to recruit other addicts.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9585676/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Xavier_Stone"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"A unique tale, a bit overdone and barely alright","reviewBody":"The start and setup of this movie is decent and it tells an interesting story. However the financials are way out of whack and ruins any true insight. The wandering path is done adequately enough but it feels half finished and leaves an unsatisfied feeling at the completion. Maybe it's just me, but if you're going to make a movie about preaching the dangers of drugs and wanting people to change I think you need to put an effort into making a good film. Otherwise it's easily forgotten 5 minutes after watching it, like this one is.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2213,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2021-02-19","keywords":"los angeles california,drug addiction,addiction,fraud,reference to the affordable care act","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2724708633","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTVjODUwYjktOTM3OC00OGZhLWI0MGYtOWU4ODFkNTFkMDk4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTVjODUwYjktOTM3OC00OGZhLWI0MGYtOWU4ODFkNTFkMDk4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Utah and Opal are junkies living on the streets of rural Ohio until a seemingly chance encounter with the enigmatic Wood (Michael Kenneth Williams) brings them to Los Angeles for treatment. While Utah finds sobriety with the help of the treatment center shrink (Academy Award®-Winner Melissa Leo), he soon learns that rehab is not about helping people--it's merely a cover scheme for a multibillion dollar fraud operation, enlisting addicts to recruit other addicts. Seduced by the money, but troubled by the hypocrisy, Utah must decide between what will make him rich, and what will save Opal."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm12333318/","name":"Suzanne Wind"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0342029/","name":"Frank Grillo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2129444/","name":"Alice Englert"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6461537/","name":"John Swab"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0320829/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0586673/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0474730/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6461537/","name":"John Swab"}],"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Kiler: Directed by Juliusz Machulski. With Cezary Pazura, Malgorzata Kozuchowska, Jerzy Stuhr, Janusz Rewinski. An innocent cab driver Jurek Kiler is mistaken for a contract killer and imprisoned. Soon, he is sprung by a mob boss who needs "Killer" for a few more jobs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0127626/","name":"Kiler","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDRkNWMxYWEtODUwMC00ZDRjLWI0MmQtMjFjNTFiMDYwZDZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjExODE1MDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"An innocent cab driver Jurek Kiler is mistaken for a contract killer and imprisoned. programme.title: Pornografia
Pornografia
programme.desc:
Pornografia: Directed by Jan Jakub Kolski. With Krzysztof Majchrzak, Adam Ferency, Krzysztof Globisz, Grazyna Blecka-Kolska. Two intellectuals, a writer and a director, begin to play a mysterious psychological game in a peaceful countryside manor house during the Nazi occupation." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0357037/","name":"Pornografia","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyNTY3ODE2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODMwNTQ4Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two intellectuals, a writer and a director, begin to play a mysterious psychological game in a peaceful countryside manor house during the Nazi occupation.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0357037/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Mengedegna"},"dateCreated":"2003-10-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Spielberg should sue","reviewBody":"What on earth could have possessed the NY Film Festival selection committee to inflict this pretentious, boring, derivative, ugly and silly piece of third-rate filmmaking on its audience? Because it's Polish and we haven't had a lot of worthwhile Polish movies since Kieslowski? Has it come to that?

The film takes Witold Gombrowicz's long-winded but intermittently fascinating classic novel and superimposes a gratuitous (and fatuous) Spielbergesque holocaust plot line, to make it all, I guess, more compelling. The effect is glaringly contrived and (as with the far better Spielberg original) offensively trivializing.

In case anyone misses the point, the holocaust plot overlay involves a doomed little girl and, at the dénouement, a shift to a black-and-white background against which is displayed, in color, a talismanic link to her. Sound familiar? Spielberg should sue.

The sad thing is that there is some talent at work here. Though the plot is gratuitously confusing, meandering, and contrived, the use of a country house around which a low-intensity conflict between Germans and Polish partisans swirls obliquely is effective, with the fighting intruding suddenly into and then just as suddenly vanishing from the playing out of the protagonists' humdrum idleness and self-absorption. Grayzna Blecka-Kolska gives a performance that almost transcends the clichés written into her role as the quietly tipsy châtelaine, and the two young people who are the objects of the middle-aged protagonists' dirty-old-man obsessions (Gombrowicz's central plot line, if no longer Kolski's) look as if they might have been far more effectively used in some other movie, one in which they were given something to do beyond standing around and looking beautiful (which they are, it should be said). But on the whole, this is an over-the-top, pretentious dud, the sort of thing that should be seen only by the paid critics who then have a professional obligation and civic duty to spare all the rest of us such an irritating waste of our time.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":939,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Romance","War"],"datePublished":"2003-10-17","keywords":"sex standing up,lift skirt,panties hit the floor,panties pulled down,fondling","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0538048/","name":"Krzysztof Majchrzak"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0272295/","name":"Adam Ferency"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322937/","name":"Krzysztof Globisz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0464383/","name":"Jan Jakub Kolski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043688/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0090290/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0094194/","name":"Luc Bondy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0102722/","name":"Gérard Brach"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0326822/","name":"Witold Gombrowicz"}],"duration":"PT1H57M"}</script><metacontent="

Wiera is a beautiful and well-trained agent of the former KGB, sent to Poland to steal the young genius's potion. programme.title: Moda na "Króla"
programme.desc: Dokument zdradza kulisy wyjątkowego pomysłu łączącego świat mody i filmu. Widzowie poznają projektantów oraz śledzą etapy powstawania kolekcji, która inspirowana jest duchem epoki z serialowej superprodukcji.

programme.title: Jak powstawał serial "Król"
programme.desc: Kulisy powstawania serialu "Król" w reżyserii Jana P. Matuszyńskiego. Produkcja stanowi ekranizację powieści Szczepana Twardocha o tym samym tytule.

programme.title: Jakubiak lokalnie 3
programme.desc: Tomasz Jakubiak po raz trzeci wyrusza w Polskę, aby odkrywać lokalne smaki i aromaty. Odwiedza różne miejsca i czerpie inspiracje z różnych produktów. Łączy nieznane tradycyjne smaki z kucharską maestrią. Tym razem prowadzący przypomina widzom o istnieniu krajowych serów pleśniowych, tradycyjnych jogurtów oraz doskonałych ziół, rewelacyjnych miodów pitnych a także potraw, które od stuleci przygotowują, mieszkające w naszym kraju mniejszości narodowe.

programme.title: News+
programme.desc: Podsumowanie najważniejszych wydarzeń z aren sportowych. Omówienie sukcesów, rekordów i porażek. Program prowadzą zamiennie m.in. Piotr Karpiński, Piotr Salak, Wojciech Zawioła i Gabriel Rogaczewski.

programme.title: Tenis: Turniej WTA Finals w Guadalajarze
programme.desc: Program w całości poświęcony rozgrywkom ligi hiszpańskiej. Widzowie będą mogli zobaczyć obszerne skróty wszystkich meczów minionego weekendu oraz bramki. Program nie ma komentarza, jest prezentowany z naturalnym dźwiękiem pochodzącym ze stadionów.

programme.title: 365 obiadów Mariety Mareckiej
programme.desc: Gospodyni programu podpowiada, skąd czerpać inspiracje na codzienne obiady. Marieta Marecka zaprezentuje szereg prostych posiłków. W każdym odcinku zaprezentuje trzy nowe, często zaskakujące potrawy.

programme.title: Zielona rewolucja Marty Dymek
programme.desc: Popularna blogerka Marta Dymek w każdym odcinku próbuje przekonać zaproszonego gościa do kuchni wegetariańskiej. Prowadząca pokaże, jak zastąpić potrawy mięsne ich jarskimi wariacjami.

programme.title: Bitwa na smaki: David vs Matteo 3
Bitwa na smaki: David vs Matteo 3
programme.desc: David Gaboriaud I Matteo Brunetti po raz trzeci staną do kulinarnego pojedynku. W każdym odcinku kucharze zaprezentują swoje umiejętności w próbie przygotowanej przez przybyłych do studia gości.

programme.title: Gdzie rosną pieniądze
programme.desc: Praktyczny poradnik w duchu zero waste. Joanna Dymmel, autorka książki "Gdzie rosną pieniądze", udowadnia, że domy i mieszkania są pełne rzeczy, na których można zarobić. W szafach, na pawlaczach, na strychach, w piwnicach czy garażach zalegają przedmioty, które mogą być źródłem dodatkowej gotówki. Prowadząca odwiedzi widzów, by pomóc im wybrać, wycenić i przygotować do sprzedaży rozmaite rzeczy, mogące przynieść zysk bez wychodzenia z domu.

programme.title: Gdzie rosną pieniądze

programme.title: Listy do więzienia
The Letter Room
programme.desc: Dobroduszny, ale samotny Richard (Oscar Isaac) zostaje dyrektorem więzienia. Teraz musi przeglądać całą korespondencję osadzonych. Czytając ich listy, zaczyna bliżej poznawać prywatne sprawy podopiecznych. Interesuje się zwłaszcza skazańcem znajdującym się w celi śmierci. Postanawia podjąć działania, które wydają mu się słuszne.

programme.title: Tenis: Turniej WTA Finals w Guadalajarze
programme.desc: Cykl wywiadów przeprowadzanych przez Tomka Ćwiąkałę z ważnymi postaciami ze świata futbolu. Wśród nich są mistrzowie świata, Europy i gwiazdy topowych lig. Widzowie dowiedzą się, czym zajmują się dzisiaj, jak wspominają swoje kariery oraz poznają ich plany na przyszłość.

programme.title: THE LEGENDS z Tomkiem Ćwiąkałą

programme.title: 365 obiadów Mariety Mareckiej
programme.desc: Gospodyni programu podpowiada, skąd czerpać inspiracje na codzienne obiady. Marieta Marecka zaprezentuje szereg prostych posiłków. W każdym odcinku zaprezentuje trzy nowe, często zaskakujące potrawy.

programme.title: Zielona rewolucja Marty Dymek
programme.desc: Popularna blogerka Marta Dymek w każdym odcinku próbuje przekonać zaproszonego gościa do kuchni wegetariańskiej. Prowadząca pokaże, jak zastąpić potrawy mięsne ich jarskimi wariacjami.

programme.title: Kupione i co dalej? 4
programme.desc: Projektantka Marta Czerkies urządza kolejne mieszkania i domy w stanie deweloperskim. Pomaga dostosować wizję wymarzonego wnętrza do możliwości finansowych. W programie znajdzie się też wiele praktycznych porad, inspiracji i remontowych trików.

programme.title: Remont w 48h
programme.desc: Tomasz Pągowski odwiedza ludzi, którzy chcieliby zrobić w swoim mieszkaniu remont, ale boją się kosztów i utrudnień. Architekt udowodni im, że metamorfozę można przeprowadzić szybko, tanio i bezproblemowo.

programme.title: News+
programme.desc: Podsumowanie najważniejszych wydarzeń z aren sportowych. Omówienie sukcesów, rekordów i porażek. Program prowadzą zamiennie m.in. Piotr Karpiński, Piotr Salak, Wojciech Zawioła i Gabriel Rogaczewski.

programme.title: Hollywood Buzz
programme.desc: W programie nowości kinowe, relacje z planów zdjęciowych oraz ciekawostki związanych z gwiazdami srebrnego ekranu. O pracy nad najnowszymi hollywoodzkimi produkcjami opowiadają ich twórcy - znani reżyserzy i aktorzy. Autorzy magazynu przedstawiają również zwiastuny filmów wchodzących na ekrany kin.

programme.title: Shadow in the Cloud

Shadow in the Cloud
programme.desc:
Shadow in the Cloud: Directed by Roseanne Liang. With Chloë Grace Moretz, Nick Robinson, Beulah Koale, Taylor John Smith. A female WWII pilot traveling with top secret documents on a B-17 Flying Fortress encounters an evil presence on board the flight." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9691136/","name":"Shadow in the Cloud","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNiNGQyMzUtN2VmMi00NDI2LWI3NGUtMTEwZGQxYzFjZTNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyNDk3MjY3._V1_.jpg","description":"A female WWII pilot traveling with top secret documents on a B-17 Flying Fortress encounters an evil presence on board the flight.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9691136/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TxMike"},"dateCreated":"2021-06-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Kick-Ass grown up, in WW2, and Rod Serling would be proud.","reviewBody":"The old Twilight Zone TV shows, remember the monster on the airplane wing? This movie does that old TV series proud.

Most of the very bad ratings here are given by viewers who somehow took this for a serious movie. It is not. It is a spoof of sorts, of the competent hard-working women of WW2, and the old signs cautioning workers to avoid gremlins. Here the gremlins are real, they are dangerous, and a super woman of sorts has to save the day.

Chloë Grace Moretz ten years earlier starred in Kick Ass, another movie not to be taken too seriously. Here she is Maude Garrett who boards a military flight out of New Zealand in 1943, presenting "orders" that she is supposed to be there with a top secret package.

This movie is about as real as the old Bugs Bunny and Roadrunner cartoons. I was invested all the way and found it to be entertaining, fun escapism. That's all it is. Moretz is great.

At home on DVD from my public library, my wife skipped."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22359,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Horror","War"],"datePublished":"2021-01-01","keywords":"boeing b 17 flying fortress,world war two,electronic music score,1940s,year 1943","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Teaser","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3659972889","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNThlYWYxY2UtZTQxMy00ZjkyLWExNDMtMjc4MDAzMThmZTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNThlYWYxY2UtZTQxMy00ZjkyLWExNDMtMjc4MDAzMThmZTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg","description":"A female WWII pilot traveling with top secret documents on a B-17 Flying Fortress encounters an evil presence on board the flight."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1631269/","name":"Chloë Grace Moretz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3538718/","name":"Nick Robinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3872230/","name":"Beulah Koale"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1755396/","name":"Roseanne Liang"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0308127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0628817/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0484840/","name":"Max Landis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1755396/","name":"Roseanne Liang"}],"duration":"PT1H23M"}</script><metacontent="

7 powodów do ucieczki
7 raons per fugir (de la societat)
programme.desc: 7 raons per fugir: Directed by Gerard Quinto, Esteve Soler, David Torras. With Francesc Orella, Rosa Cadafalch, Pol López, Vicky Peña. The family, the tenant, the wedding, the businessman, the neighbors, the poor child and the run over. 7 black comedy stories of a dysfunctional society." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7416602/","name":"7 raons per fugir","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM2OTI2N2ItZGM3Yi00ZTJmLWI5M2UtMDUxYjU0NWIwNDhiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The family, the tenant, the wedding, the businessman, the neighbors, the poor child and the run over. 7 black comedy stories of a dysfunctional society.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7416602/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JvH48"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"7 Short stories assembled into 75-minutes feature, each hilarious and unpredictable. Filmcrew and actors are common. Nothing else binds stories together","reviewBody":"Saw this at the Brussel International Fantastic Film Festival 2019 (BIFFF for intimates). 7 Hilarious stories, some 10 minutes each, told one after another. In other words, we see 7 shorts assembled into one feature length movie. Writers, directors and actors are more or less common to the 7 stories, and the whole footage is shot in a handful of weeks, at a moment when all involved actors were available full time. (info from the Q&A after the screening).\n\nEach of the stories gives us something to ponder about, either by turning things around in an unusual but interesting way, or to include some social commentary in an unexpected way. Lots of good ideas are included. I am not sure there is a morale, or one or more packaged messages as takeaways. I saw no final wrapup to tie all story lines together, so I stay with my statement about 7 shorts shown after another.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":545,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2019-04-05","keywords":"black comedy,black humor,surrealism,anthology film,social commentary","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Tráiler [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3595811353","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDIwNmQ5MTQtYzhiOC00MzdiLWI5ODItNGJhMjg5YmI2NGEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDIwNmQ5MTQtYzhiOC00MzdiLWI5ODItNGJhMjg5YmI2NGEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0649649/","name":"Francesc Orella"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1748319/","name":"Rosa Cadafalch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2205196/","name":"Pol López"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4313632/","name":"Gerard Quinto"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2706147/","name":"Esteve Soler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4314663/","name":"David Torras"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0660858/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0456857/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0573845/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2706147/","name":"Esteve Soler"}],"duration":"PT1H15M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Zabij to i wyjedz z tego miasta
Zabij to i wyjedź z tego miasta
programme.desc:
Zabij to i wyjedz z tego miasta: Directed by Mariusz Wilczynski. With Krystyna Janda, Andrzej Chyra, Maja Ostaszewska, Malgorzata Kozuchowska. Fleeing from despair after losing those dearest to him, the hero hides in a safe land of memories, where time stands still and all those dear to him are alive." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8387918/","name":"Zabij to i wyjedz z tego miasta","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE5MjViZDMtNjE0Ny00MWQ1LTgzY2ItZDZjNWQ5YjBmMTI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEzMjUxMDM3._V1_.jpg","description":"Fleeing from despair after losing those dearest to him, the hero hides in a safe land of memories, where time stands still and all those dear to him are alive.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8387918/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"samxxxul"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"A fabulous Lynchian nightmare!","reviewBody":"The first feature film by acclaimed Polish animator Mariusz Wilczynsk completed over an 11-year production period. There is a lot of stories and emotions connected to the making of this project. The journey surely was not an easy ride for the polish animator who lost his long-time friend and music collaborator Tadeusz Nalepa during the process.

Briefly to the plot, I would say it as a mixture of dreams and memories of Wilczynski's upbringing in the industrial town of Lodz in the 60's and 70s during the dehumanization of life under Communist Poland. The filmmaker himself is part of the play and appears as an obese nude giant and recalls his parents and the socio-political situation in the communist Poland. The story places us in the disturbed head of our protagonist and we see his surreal version of the timeline and slowly descending into madness. From the very first frames, a surreal delirium of suggestions and the symbolic predominates over the laws of rationality. The narrative is reflected visually and metaphorically, and it succeeds in creating such disturbing experience with the scribbly style has an aesthetic at its best. Even the morbid images of human pet, ugly streets, the autopsy, bloody beaked birds, junk sea and the ship contain a right balance and it is not overdone just for the gore quotient. In addition, the music is staged for the surreal effect, stands on its own and manages to set the right accents. Also, I was surprised to see the voice for the old man in the train with the newspaper was done by late Andrzej Wajda.

Final thoughts, the film is a nightmare that gets under your skin visually and plays deep into the consciousness. I would say the film clearly owes a debt to David Lynch and this is not to criticise or say that I didn't love the experience. I did and it was Lynchian, sometimes it reminded me of demo tapes album art from 90s grindcore bands, a little of Ujichaa, little of David Shrigley or Roland Topor, and some Bill Plympton vibes all mixed into one that in several places is close to the grotesque and beautiful. To the fans who possess a love for surrealism and adore the aforementioned artists, check it out I highly recommend that you do so.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":695,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"genre":["Animation","Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-03-05","keywords":"hero","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi642563609","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdlNmYyMDItYjdmNS00NTJmLTkyYWQtNTNjM2RkMTFkNGM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdlNmYyMDItYjdmNS00NTJmLTkyYWQtNTNjM2RkMTFkNGM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0417370/","name":"Krystyna Janda"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0161607/","name":"Andrzej Chyra"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0652292/","name":"Maja Ostaszewska"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1295507/","name":"Mariusz Wilczynski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0799710/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0723136/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0704662/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1295507/","name":"Mariusz Wilczynski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1294751/","name":"Agnieszka Scibior"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 8387918, Title: Zabij to i wyjedz z tego miasta, --- Description: Zabij to i wyjedz z tego miasta: Directed by Mariusz Wilczynski. With Krystyna Janda, Andrzej Chyra, Maja Ostaszewska, Malgorzata Kozuchowska. Fleeing from despair after losing those dearest to him, the hero hides in a safe land of memories, where time stands still and all those dear to him are alive." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8387918/","name":"Zabij to i wyjedz z tego miasta","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE5MjViZDMtNjE0Ny00MWQ1LTgzY2ItZDZjNWQ5YjBmMTI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEzMjUxMDM3._V1_.jpg","description":"Fleeing from despair after losing those dearest to him, the hero hides in a safe land of memories, where time stands still and all those dear to him are alive.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8387918/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"samxxxul","dateCreated":"2020-12-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"A fabulous Lynchian nightmare!","reviewBody":"The first feature film by acclaimed Polish animator Mariusz Wilczynsk completed over an 11-year production period. There is a lot of stories and emotions connected to the making of this project. The journey surely was not an easy ride for the polish animator who lost his long-time friend and music collaborator Tadeusz Nalepa during the process.

Briefly to the plot, I would say it as a mixture of dreams and memories of Wilczynski's upbringing in the industrial town of Lodz in the 60's and 70s during the dehumanization of life under Communist Poland. The filmmaker himself is part of the play and appears as an obese nude giant and recalls his parents and the socio-political situation in the communist Poland. The story places us in the disturbed head of our protagonist and we see his surreal version of the timeline and slowly descending into madness. From the very first frames, a surreal delirium of suggestions and the symbolic predominates over the laws of rationality. The narrative is reflected visually and metaphorically, and it succeeds in creating such disturbing experience with the scribbly style has an aesthetic at its best. Even the morbid images of human pet, ugly streets, the autopsy, bloody beaked birds, junk sea and the ship contain a right balance and it is not overdone just for the gore quotient. In addition, the music is staged for the surreal effect, stands on its own and manages to set the right accents. Also, I was surprised to see the voice for the old man in the train with the newspaper was done by late Andrzej Wajda.

Final thoughts, the film is a nightmare that gets under your skin visually and plays deep into the consciousness. I would say the film clearly owes a debt to David Lynch and this is not to criticise or say that I didn't love the experience. I did and it was Lynchian, sometimes it reminded me of demo tapes album art from 90s grindcore bands, a little of Ujichaa, little of David Shrigley or Roland Topor, and some Bill Plympton vibes all mixed into one that in several places is close to the grotesque and beautiful. To the fans who possess a love for surrealism and adore the aforementioned artists, check it out I highly recommend that you do so.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":695,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"genre":["Animation","Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-03-05","keywords":"hero","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi642563609","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdlNmYyMDItYjdmNS00NTJmLTkyYWQtNTNjM2RkMTFkNGM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdlNmYyMDItYjdmNS00NTJmLTkyYWQtNTNjM2RkMTFkNGM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0417370/","name":"Krystyna Janda","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0161607/","name":"Andrzej Chyra","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0652292/","name":"Maja Ostaszewska"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1295507/","name":"Mariusz Wilczynski"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0799710/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0723136/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0704662/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1295507/","name":"Mariusz Wilczynski","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1294751/","name":"Agnieszka Scibior"],"duration":"PT1H28M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Wielka szpera
programme.desc: Wrzesień 1942 roku, getto w Łodzi. Niemcy ogłaszają zakaz opuszczania domów i organizują wywózkę ponad 15 tysięcy żydowskich dzieci oraz starców do obozu zagłady w Chełmnie. Te wstrząsające wydarzenia przeszły do historii pod nazwą "Wielkiej szpery". Przed kamerą mówią o niej ludzie, którzy przeżyli tamte tragiczne dni.

programme.title: My Cousin Vinny
Mój kuzyn Vinny
My Cousin Vinny
programme.desc: My Cousin Vinny: Directed by Jonathan Lynn. With Joe Pesci, Ralph Macchio, Marisa Tomei, Mitchell Whitfield. Two New Yorkers accused of murder in rural Alabama while on their way back to college call in the help of one of their cousins, a loudmouth lawyer with no trial experience." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0104952/","name":"My Cousin Vinny","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxNDYzMTg1M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzk4MDgxMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two New Yorkers accused of murder in rural Alabama while on their way back to college call in the help of one of their cousins, a loudmouth lawyer with no trial experience.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0104952/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"linoochie"},"dateCreated":"2005-08-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"The more I watch it --- the funnier it gets!!","reviewBody":"Definitely one of my all-time favorite comedies. Well directed, well acted -- priceless comic performances by Pesci, Tomei, Gwynne & Austin Pendleton. And more than comedy -- there's also a lot of genuine pathos and real tension and drama, especially in the final courtroom scene. And I really don't understand the "controversy" or brouhaha over Marisa Tomei receiving the Best Supporting Actress Oscar for her role in this movie. It's a crackerjack gem of a performance and a stellar comic portrayal. The only thing I can figure is that a lot of snobbery about serious dramatic portrayals somehow being more worthy of honor than great comic performances still very much lives on in much of the film community.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":116045,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1992-03-13","keywords":"lawyer,trial,italian american,alabama,jail","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"My Cousin Vinny","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2744844569","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjc2NWI4YjctMWVhMy00MGViLTk5NzQtZGMwYWY3MzQwZWZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjc2NWI4YjctMWVhMy00MGViLTk5NzQtZGMwYWY3MzQwZWZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000582/","name":"Joe Pesci"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000673/","name":"Marisa Tomei"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001494/","name":"Ralph Macchio"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0528718/","name":"Jonathan Lynn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057987/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0731057/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0490958/","name":"Dale Launer"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="
